articles.headline: Want to Shop for a Surprise? Try a Subscription Box
articles.snippet: The business is precarious, with thin margins on low-cost supplies, but the interest, in items from makeup to animal treats to fantasy fiction, is growing.
articles.abstract: The business is precarious, with thin margins on low-cost supplies, but the interest, in items from makeup to animal treats to fantasy fiction, is growing.
articles.lead_paragraph: Need a monthly delivery of doomsday prepping supplies? How about treats for your pet rabbit, or only-available-in-Japan snacks like Umashi Oasi Cheetos?

articles.headline: F.D.A. Warns Company Over Kardashian Instagram Marketing
articles.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration said that Kim Kardashian West’s promotion of a morning-sickness product did not mention the drug’s risks.
articles.abstract: The Food and Drug Administration said that Kim Kardashian West’s promotion of a morning-sickness product did not mention the drug’s risks.

articles.headline: Devaluation Hints at China’s Rising Distress Over Economy
articles.snippet: China allowed the renminbi to weaken significantly for a third consecutive day, its biggest plunge in decades, increasing concerns that the sluggish economy is even worse off and that the government is panicking.
articles.abstract: China allowed the renminbi to weaken significantly for a third consecutive day, its biggest plunge in decades, increasing concerns that the sluggish economy is even worse off and that the government is panicking.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Whenever China’s economy swooned in recent downturns, its currency never buckled. It held steady, or strengthened, even as China’s neighbors or trading partners scrambled to cut the value of their own currencies to deal with the fallout.

articles.headline: Facial Recognition Software Moves From Overseas Wars to Local Police
articles.snippet: Dozens of police departments have begun using facial recognition technology to pursue conventional criminal suspects like drug dealers and prostitutes.
articles.abstract: Dozens of police departments have begun using facial recognition technology to pursue conventional criminal suspects like drug dealers and prostitutes.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO — Facial recognition software, which American military and intelligence agencies used for years in Iraq and Afghanistan to identify potential terrorists, is being eagerly adopted by dozens of police departments around the country to pursue drug dealers, prostitutes and other conventional criminal suspects. But because it is being used with few guidelines and with little oversight or public disclosure, it is raising questions of privacy and concerns about potential misuse.

articles.headline: Vertical Video on the Small Screen? Not a Crime
articles.snippet: There are strong opinions about whether to shoot video vertically or horizontally. Holding your phone the “wrong way” provokes both professional and amateur photographers.
articles.abstract: There are strong opinions about whether to shoot video vertically or horizontally. Holding your phone the “wrong way” provokes both professional and amateur photographers.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2012, Vincent Bova and Damien Eckhardt-Jacobi, two puppeteers who host a YouTube series called Glove and Boots, created a public service announcement to warn viewers about what they considered a modern scourge: People keep shooting videos while holding their phones vertically.

articles.headline: Carly Fiorina Emerges as a G.O.P. Weapon Against ‘War on Women’ Charge
articles.snippet: After months of attacking Hillary Rodham Clinton, the former  Hewlett-Packard executive began to gain traction as debate viewers saw her as singularly qualified to take on Donald J. Trump.
articles.abstract: After months of attacking Hillary Rodham Clinton, the former  Hewlett-Packard executive began to gain traction as debate viewers saw her as singularly qualified to take on Donald J. Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: This week, Donald J. Trump said that listening to Carly Fiorina, the only woman competing for the Republican presidential nomination, gave him “a massive headache.”
articles.byline: By Amy Chozick and Trip Gabriel

articles.headline: Scandals in Brazil Prompt Fears of a Return to Turmoil
articles.snippet: Some Brazilians are calling for the impeachment of President Dilma Rousseff amid corruption scandals. And the sense of political uncertainty ranks among the country’s worst since the 1980s.
articles.abstract: Some Brazilians are calling for the impeachment of President Dilma Rousseff amid corruption scandals. And the sense of political uncertainty ranks among the country’s worst since the 1980s.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The president is battling calls for her impeachment. The speaker of Brazil’s lower house is grappling with accusations that he pocketed a $5 million bribe. The former treasurer of the governing Workers Party is in jail.

articles.headline: The Perils of Ever-Changing Work Schedules Extend to Children’s Well-Being
articles.snippet: Research suggests that as a result of parents’ problematic schedules, children’s language and problem-solving skills may suffer and they may be more likely to smoke and drink as they grow older.
articles.abstract: Research suggests that as a result of parents’ problematic schedules, children’s language and problem-solving skills may suffer and they may be more likely to smoke and drink as they grow older.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Abercrombie & Fitch announced last week that it would stop requiring workers to be on call for shifts that could be canceled with little notice, making it the latest retailer to pull back from such scheduling practices.

articles.headline: Donors Descend on Schumer and Others in Debate on Iran
articles.snippet: The passions of big contributors — and their ability to change a candidate’s fortunes — are a keenly felt undercurrent to the debate over the fate of President Obama’s nuclear deal with Iran.
articles.abstract: The passions of big contributors — and their ability to change a candidate’s fortunes — are a keenly felt undercurrent to the debate over the fate of President Obama’s nuclear deal with Iran.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the weeks before Senator Chuck Schumer’s decision to oppose the Iran nuclear accord, John Shapiro, a New York financier and a leader of the American Jewish Committee, had his ear, plying him with reasons to oppose it.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Weisman and Nicholas Confessore

articles.headline: ISIS Enshrines a Theology of Rape
articles.snippet: Claiming the Quran’s support, the Islamic State codifies sex slavery in conquered regions of Iraq and Syria and uses the practice as a recruiting tool.
articles.abstract: Claiming the Quran’s support, the Islamic State codifies sex slavery in conquered regions of Iraq and Syria and uses the practice as a recruiting tool.
articles.lead_paragraph: QADIYA, Iraq — In the moments before he raped the 12-year-old girl, the Islamic State fighter took the time to explain that what he was about to do was not a sin. Because the preteen girl practiced a religion other than Islam, the Quran not only gave him the right to rape her — it condoned and encouraged it, he insisted.

articles.headline: ‘Sesame Street’ to Air First on HBO for Next 5 Seasons
articles.snippet: Under the deal, production will increase to 35 episodes a year from the current 18, and a spinoff show and another new educational series for children will be created.
articles.abstract: Under the deal, production will increase to 35 episodes a year from the current 18, and a spinoff show and another new educational series for children will be created.
articles.lead_paragraph: The letters of the day on “Sesame Street” are H, B and O.

articles.headline: John Kasich’s Appeal to Moderates Gains Traction in New Hampshire
articles.snippet: Gov. John Kasich is rising in the polls in New Hampshire, winning endorsements and drawing new voters to his appearances who were impressed with his debate performance.
articles.abstract: Gov. John Kasich is rising in the polls in New Hampshire, winning endorsements and drawing new voters to his appearances who were impressed with his debate performance.
articles.lead_paragraph: DERRY, N.H. — Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio unabashedly promotes his expansion of Medicaid under Obamacare, shows little appetite for relitigating culture-war battles like same-sex marriage and offers not much more than a shrug when asked about Hillary Rodham Clinton’s turning over her email server to the F.B.I.
